title: 1969 AMC AMX 390 4-Speed
description: This 1969 AMC AMX was initially delivered to Dick Allen Motors in Inglewood, California, and optioned with Go Package equipment, including a Twin-Grip limited-slip differential, the Handling Package, front disc brakes, and a heavy-duty cooling system. Power is provided by a 390ci V8 that is backed by a four-speed manual transmission, and the Beale St. Blue finish is adorned with black over-the-top stripes. The car was also optioned with the Visibility and Light Groups and has 14″ Magnum 500-style wheels, a Hurst shifter, a push-button AM radio, and Charcoal vinyl upholstery. Acquired by the seller in 2016, this AMX is now offered with a window sticker and a clean Massachusetts title in the seller's name.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 1969 AMC AMX 390 4-Speed at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #193,313.
text: This 1969 AMC AMX was initially delivered to Dick Allen Motors in Inglewood, California, and optioned with Go Package equipment, including a Twin-Grip limited-slip differential, the Handling Package, front disc brakes, and a heavy-duty cooling system. Power is provided by a 390ci V8 that is backed by a four-speed manual transmission, and the Beale St. Blue finish is adorned with black over-the-top stripes. The car was also optioned with the Visibility and Light Groups and has 14″ Magnum 500-style wheels, a Hurst shifter, a push-button AM radio, and Charcoal vinyl upholstery. Acquired by the seller in 2016, this AMX is now offered with a window sticker and a clean Massachusetts title in the seller’s name. Finished in Beale St. Blue with black over-the-top stripes, the car has faux hood louvers, a power-adjustable driver-side mirror, sail-panel AMX badging, and dual exhaust outlets. The seller notes that the left rear panel has been replaced. Magnum 500-style 14″ wheels are mounted with BFGoodrich Radial T/A tires. Braking is provided by front discs and rear drums. The car was optioned with the Handling Package and quick-ratio steering. The reclining bucket seats are upholstered in Charcoal Ventilaire vinyl, and interior appointments include woodgrain trim, a Hurst shifter, and a push-button AM radio. The wood-rimmed steering wheel has cracks and fronts a 140-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and a combination gauge for coolant temperature and fuel level. The five-digit odometer shows 86k miles, approximately 3k of which were added under current ownership. The X-code 390ci V8 was factory equipped with a four-barrel carburetor and rated at 315 horsepower and 425 lb-ft of torque when new. An optional heavy-duty cooling system was fitted from the factory. Power is routed to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission and a Twin-Grip limited-slip differential with an optional 13-41 gear ratio. The dual exhaust system is fitted with Flowmaster mufflers. Decoding the body plate reveals the following information: Body: R029139 – Kenosha assembly plant, sequential body number Model: 6939-7 – 1969 AMX Two-Door Sports Coupe Trim: 931F – Charcoal Ventilaire vinyl Color: P64 – Beale St. Blue Metallic The window sticker shows initial delivery to Dick Allen Motors in Inglewood, California, along with a total suggested retail price of $3,962.20. html:
This 1969 AMC AMX was initially delivered to Dick Allen Motors in Inglewood, California, and optioned with Go Package equipment, including a Twin-Grip limited-slip differential, the Handling Package, front disc brakes, and a heavy-duty cooling system. Power is provided by a 390ci V8 that is backed by a four-speed manual transmission, and the Beale St. Blue finish is adorned with black over-the-top stripes. The car was also optioned with the Visibility and Light Groups and has 14″ Magnum 500-style wheels, a Hurst shifter, a push-button AM radio, and Charcoal vinyl upholstery. Acquired by the seller in 2016, this AMX is now offered with a window sticker and a clean Massachusetts title in the seller’s name.

Finished in Beale St. Blue with black over-the-top stripes, the car has faux hood louvers, a power-adjustable driver-side mirror, sail-panel AMX badging, and dual exhaust outlets. The seller notes that the left rear panel has been replaced.

Magnum 500-style 14″ wheels are mounted with BFGoodrich Radial T/A tires. Braking is provided by front discs and rear drums. The car was optioned with the Handling Package and quick-ratio steering.

The reclining bucket seats are upholstered in Charcoal Ventilaire vinyl, and interior appointments include woodgrain trim, a Hurst shifter, and a push-button AM radio.

The wood-rimmed steering wheel has cracks and fronts a 140-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and a combination gauge for coolant temperature and fuel level. The five-digit odometer shows 86k miles, approximately 3k of which were added under current ownership.

The X-code 390ci V8 was factory equipped with a four-barrel carburetor and rated at 315 horsepower and 425 lb-ft of torque when new. An optional heavy-duty cooling system was fitted from the factory.

Power is routed to the rear wheels through a four-speed manual transmission and a Twin-Grip limited-slip differential with an optional 13-41 gear ratio. The dual exhaust system is fitted with Flowmaster mufflers.

Decoding the body plate reveals the following information:

  • Body: R029139 – Kenosha assembly plant, sequential body number
  • Model: 6939-7 – 1969 AMX Two-Door Sports Coupe
  • Trim: 931F – Charcoal Ventilaire vinyl
  • Color: P64 – Beale St. Blue Metallic

The window sticker shows initial delivery to Dick Allen Motors in Inglewood, California, along with a total suggested retail price of $3,962.20.
